summary: Diff introduces a new `contentClassName` prop on `SafeSelect` and applies it to the Admin Products category filter dropdown, but the provided diff excerpts do not show (a) `SafeSelect` actually wiring that prop to the rendered `SelectContent`, (b) the same styling being applied to the ProductUpsertModal category dropdown, or (c) the required admin-scoped CSS class being appended in `index.css` to enforce max-height/scrollbar/touch scrolling.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add an opt-in way to style the dropdown menu container for SafeSelect so specific callers can apply a max-height and scrolling without changing default behavior of other selects.
missing_requirements.reason: While `SafeSelectProps` includes `contentClassName?: string` and callers can pass it, the diff snippet is truncated before showing that `contentClassName` is actually applied to the rendered `SelectContent` element; therefore the key acceptance criterion (class applied specifically to SelectContent) is not evidenced.

missing_requirements.requirement: Apply the same max-height (10 items) + vertical scrolling behavior to the category selection dropdown inside the Add/Edit Product modal (ProductUpsertModal).
missing_requirements.reason: The `ProductUpsertModal.tsx` diff excerpt is truncated and does not show the category `SafeSelect` usage nor any `contentClassName="admin-category-select-content"` (or equivalent) being applied there.

missing_requirements.requirement: Create new, admin-specific CSS styles to implement the scrollable dropdown menu (max-height, overflow-y) and a clean scrollbar; include touch momentum scrolling; append styles without modifying the existing :root CSS block in frontend/src/index.css.
missing_requirements.reason: The `index.css` excerpt shown contains the existing base and toast styles, but does not include evidence of a newly appended, uniquely-scoped admin dropdown class (e.g., `.admin-category-select-content`) setting max-height/overflow-y, `-webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch`, and scoped scrollbar styling.
evidence: frontend/src/index.css (truncated; no admin dropdown class shown)
